name: places/ChIJb7dDZYBZwokRucrSPCaqkB0
formattedAddress: 178 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 178 Broome St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
The staff is super friendly and always accommodating. Even though it's mainly a Chinese staff, they all understand English and can communicate with you.
Their chef is amazing!! My toddler rarely eats vegetables, though when she's at school she will eat them, even beets. I'm not sure what the chef does, but keep up the good work!
Litter Star teachers are fantastic!! They communicate effectively (speaking to them throughout the day or even weekend if there's questions), friendly, and overall they are there for your child. My toddler absolutely loves the staff and the daycare. It eases my mind to know she's has more of a positive outlook on school.
Definitely worth checking out and enrolling your child here!

originalText.text:
Don't know why would a daycare that had an outdoor park right there at the daycare, with sprinklers and slides and
little  exercise gym be moved into a building as if children were business workers in an  office building. Children should be outside in the sunshine eating and playing and having the periods of going inside sitting down coloring learning but then at the same time able to go outside and play. I remember the little graduations that were held outdoors everything was so beautiful. Why was it changed? There was no need that I can see.

originalText.text: The best daycare with the best teachers Loving ,caring , very Educational and inspirational.  The proof is in the pudding. If your child went here you would feel the same. Daycare more like family .God Bless all the beautiful people at Little Star of Broome.
